page.title: 16HOUSING
page.content: In our four square kilometres the primary land cover is housing. Most of the houses are old, the dates carved on some of the houses started before 1900. There is a full range of house styles including terraced, semi-detached and detached. There are many more terraced houses than any other type. These terraced houses are usually found on the side of the hills overlooking the river Don. In the village of Ickles there is one public house still open, and all the rows of terraced houses have been turned into small factories and offices. The only new buildings are the seven new blocks of flats at Holmes and the flats and old folks centre at Masborough. Many houses have been demolished and we found forty four derelict houses.
